result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquan Alexander Snow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 8-18-16; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and child care. Provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge. May not vote in any election until civil rights have been restored.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marquan Alexander Snow in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  John F. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply`for work and child care.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 8/18/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 8/18/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
-6 month drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab
Per Chief Judge Directive of 14-08, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2014 this case will be assigned to Branch 15, Judge J. D. Watts, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defendant Marquan Alexander Snow in court with attorney Olya Petukova for Ann T. Bowe.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Bowe had a family emergency and is unable to appear today.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

AS TO THE AMENDED INFORMATION:  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 44.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-30-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marquan Alexander Snow in court with attorney Ann T Bowe.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
received and filed charging:  COUNT 1:  POSSESSION OF THC - 2ND AND SUBSEQUENT OFFENSE, contrary to Wis. Stats., sec(s) 961.41(3g)(e), 939.50(3)(i).

Defendant Marquan Alexander Snow in court with attorney Ann T Bowe.  Nathaniel E Adamson for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

After reviewing the case, Attorney Bowe finds there are no valid motions.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Marquan Alexander Snow in court with attorney Ann T Bowe.  Nathaniel Adamson for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court addresses Justice Point report.  
Defense counsel requests a motion hearing date.  Court orders case adjourned for Motion Hearing in Branch 44.  Any motions due no later than 5-30-2014, responses due no later than 6-06-2014.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed. cmt

Defendant Marquan Alexander Snow in court with attorney Ann T Bowe.  Nathaniel Adamson for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jason Chadwick-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/25/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marquan Alexander Snow in court with attorney Ann T Bowe.  Defendant Marquan Alexander Snow in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
